poem:
**Shadow's Legacy**

The gears of power creak,  
shadowed corridors  
where whisper turns steel.  
Men reshape liberty,  
fingers tracing lines on  
maps anew—  
inched toward tomorrow's  
resonance,  
old echoes lay  
in tangled roots,  
foundations laid  
in seasons of  
unsown trust,  
whispers summon  
unseen futures.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Dick Cheney’s role in ‘war on terror’ may have paved way for Trumpism Dick Cheney, who has died aged 84, came to be seen as a moderate in his later years for his staunch opposition to Donald Trump, but he also stands accused of paving the way for Trumpism by undermining the independence of the intelligence agencies and US adherence to international law. As George W Bush’s second-in-command in the “war on terror” declared after". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
